page.title: 14Education in Woburn 1
page.content: {Woburn Lower School The school in Woburn is a Lower School catering for children from 5 to 9. Older children (age 9 to 13) attend {Fulbrook Middle School}in Woburn Sands some two miles away. The children of Upper School age go to school in {Leighton Buzzard. There has been a school in Woburn for over{400 years.}Part of the school is now housed in a building which used to be a fire station. The big doors still remain at the front. Currently there are 34 pupils in two classes with 18 children in one class and 16 in the other. The present head is Miss J. Burleigh who has been with the school for many years. School hours are from 9am to 3.30 pm with three breaks. A royal blue uniform is being introduced in the autumn.
